comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Attestation paper stamped Jul 5 1915 found here mappingouranzacs.naa.gov.au/file-view.html?b=3055794&... 11th Reinf's 15th Battalion age 23 yrs 9 mo Commercial Traveller Next of kin: Mother, Mrs I. Bassett, Roma Villa, Roma, Queensland Signed K C Bassett

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Youngest child of Samuel Symons Bassett (1840-1912), vigeron, storekeeper and pastoralist, born Cornwall, England. In June of 1886 he started the first winery in Queensland called Romavilla. It was sold after the death of his grandson William Augustus in 1973 but is still in operation. At the time of his death Samuel was survived by his wife Isabella, nee Cameron, whom he had married at Roma on 27 July 1871, and by six sons and three daughters of their fourteen children. His estate was valued for probate at 823£. Kenneth Cameron Bassett - born 14 Sep 1891 in Roma, Queensland, died 31 Dec 1966, aged 75 years. He is buried in Mt. Thompson, Brisbane. He married Ellen Lillian Laycock. Kenneth was one of three sons who travelled for the firm. Source: www.bassettbranches.org/newsletters/2004/20041015/2004101...
